intro: Agoseris taraxacoides, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Agoseris taraxacoides is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
